</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;331ea3a0.1503">   <title>Advancing in 'R' statistics course </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;331ea3a0.1503</link>   <description> A repeat of the course titled 'ADVANCING IN R' has been scheduled for 30th November \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 4th December 2015<br><br>This course will provide an introduction to model selection and simplification, mixed effects models, generalised linear models and non-linear models<br><br>The content is designed to bridge the gap between basic R coding and more advanced statistical modelling whilst providing an overview of the most frequently used approaches to analysing data. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T20:19:33+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Hooker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;331ea3a0.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;19f5a559.1503">   <title>NEW open access article in STAR: Calculating a statistically robust \ufffd\ufffd13C and \ufffd\ufffd15N offset for charred cereal and pulse seeds</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;19f5a559.1503</link>   <description> NEW open access article in STAR: Science and Technology of Archaeological Research<br><br>Calculating a statistically robust \ufffd\ufffd13C and \ufffd\ufffd15N offset for charred cereal and pulse seeds<br><br>http://www.maneyonline.com/doi/abs/10.1179/2054892315Y.0000000001<br><br>Authors: Dr Erika Nitsch, Dr Michael Charles and Dr Amy Bogaard, Institute of Archaeology, University of Oxford, UK<br><br>This study measured \ufffd\ufffd13C and \ufffd\ufffd15N of fresh and charred seeds from six different taxa of cereals and pulses. For each taxon, 12 different batches of seeds, all from the same growing context or field, were charred for 4, 8, or 24?hours at 215, 230, 245, or 260\ufffd\ufffdC, with the thirteenth batch left uncharred. The [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T09:08:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jennifer Collinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;19f5a559.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;10544421.1502">   <title>Digital Data Reuse Award - Deadline 13th March </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;10544421.1502</link>   <description> ***Apologies for cross posting***<br><br>Internet Archaeology (http://intarch.ac.uk) and the Archaeology Data Service (http://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk) have teamed up to provide an Award that recognises the outstanding archaeological research being carried out through the re-use of digital data.<br><br>The Digital Data Re-use Award offers archaeological researchers the chance to promote their work and win the opportunity to publish, free of charge, in the premier open access journal Internet Archaeology. http://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk/blog/2014/10/digital-data-re-use-award/ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T10:37:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Archaeology Data Service</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;10544421.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;b0b83b01.1502">   <title>NEW open access article published in STAR: Modern humans' paleogenomics and the new evidences on the European prehistory </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;b0b83b01.1502</link>   <description> New open access article published in STAR: Science and Technology of Archaeological Research<br><br>'Modern humans' paleogenomics and the new evidences on the European prehistory'<br><br>By I\ufffd\ufffdigo Olalde and Carles Lalueza-Fox<br><br>Read the article: http://www.maneyonline.com/doi/abs/10.1179/2054892315Y.0000000002<br><br>The modern human settlement of Europe is a complex process with overimposed migrations and regionalisation episodes, as well as adaptive processes that shaped the genome of modern populations. New developments in massive sequencing techniques allow now the generation of an unprecedented amount of genomic data, including the genotyping of a large number of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and the generation of complete ancient genomes. These paleogenomic [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T09:54:54+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jennifer Collinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;b0b83b01.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;9054d304.1502">   <title>Lecturer or Senior Lecturer in ancient DNA </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;9054d304.1502</link>   <description> Durham University Department of Archaeology is seeking to recruit a Lecturer or Senior Lecturer in Ancient DNA. For details see<br><br>https://ig5.i-grasp.com/fe/tpl_durham01.asp?s=4A515F4E5A565B1A&amp;jobid=91102,2382499879&amp;key=97927973&amp;c=876936474034&amp;pagestamp=sebvrtmorqteuyugcr<br><br>It's an excellent place to work!<br><br>Best wishes<br><br>Andrew    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-20T16:41:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>MILLARD A.R.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;9054d304.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;b3a9d3c0.1502">   <title>FOOD & DRINK on the Roman frontiers LIMES CONGRESS Sept 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;b3a9d3c0.1502</link>   <description> This is a bit of a long shot, but\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd (and some may find other sessions of interest eg Session 18 Roman soldiers) http://www.limes2015.org/congress/paper-submission/<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS for the Food and Drink session at the LIMES (Roman frontiers) congress, Ingoldstadt, Germany 14th-20th Sept 2015<br><br>Once every three years, there is a congress on Roman Frontiers (the LIMES). It is a very sociable meeting, with days of presentations alternating with days of site visits: an excellent way to meet colleagues and discuss potential collaborative research http://www.limes2015.org/home/ [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T18:04:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stallibrass, Sue</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;b3a9d3c0.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;8d2fe500.1502">   <title>Genetic data analysis using R - STATISTICS COURSE </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;8d2fe500.1502</link>   <description> This 5 day course will be held at SCENE (Scottish Centre for Ecology and the Natural Environment), Glasgow, United Kingdom from August 3rd - 7th 2015<br><br>The course is being delivered by Dr. Thibaut Jombart who has contributed towards a number of R packages (adegenet, adephylo, geography, outbreaker, Outbreakertools, bmmix, episerve (author) and ade4 and phylobase (contributor) and Caitlin Collins (Imperial College London) who also contributes to the R packages adegenet, Outbreakertools and episerve) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-12T18:21:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Oliver Hooker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;8d2fe500.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;157c3c69.1502">   <title>FW: postdoc vacancy modern wheat genetics </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;157c3c69.1502</link>   <description> This position will be of interest to those working on plant evolutionary genetics and related areas. Please circulate to your colleagues.<br>Best wishes<br>Keri<br><br>Keri A. Brown BA M.Phil FSA<br>Honorary Lecturer in Biomolecular Archaeology<br>Associate Editor for Journal of Archaeological Science<br>Ancient DNA Consultant<br>Manchester Institute of Biotechnology<br>University of Manchester<br>131 Princess Street<br>Manchester<br>M1 7DN<br>tel +44 (0)161 306 4173    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T13:20:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Keri Brown</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;157c3c69.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item online!<br><br>Read the introduction and all the articles for free: http://www.maneyonline.com/loi/pal<br><br>Table of contents:    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-30T13:28:07+00:00</dc:date> rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;6441818c.1501">   <title>Post Doctoral Position in Organic Residue Analysis </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;6441818c.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Please find an advert below of a Post-Doctoral position in organic residue<br>analysis at the University of T\ufffd\ufffdbingen.<br><br>Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions!<br><br>With best wishes,<br><br>Cynthianne<br><br>&lt;http://www.jobs.ac.uk/employer/university-of-tuebingen&gt;<br><br>Post-Doctoral Position at the University of T\ufffd\ufffdbingen<br><br>Faculty of Humanities, Institute of Prehistory, Protohistory and Medieval<br>Archaeology<br><br>The Faculty of Humanities at the University of T\ufffd\ufffdbingen invites applications<br>for the position of a Post-Doctoral Researcher, specialising in the field of<br>organic residue analysis. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T11:49:01+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Cynthianne Debono Spiteri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;6441818c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;764bc876.1501">   <title>EAA 2014 Call for Abstracts - Exploring the production and consumption of fermented beverages and foods in pre- and protohistoric communities </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;764bc876.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>As part of the 21st Annual Meeting of the European Association of<br>Archaeologists (EAA), to be held in Glasgow between the 2nd and 5th<br>September 2015, we are organizing a session that will present topics on<br>fermented foods and beverages in pre- and protohistory, focusing mainly on<br>methods used to identify fermentation products and their cultural<br>significance. The call for abstracts is now open until the 16th February<br>2015, and we would like to invite you to submit paper/poster abstracts.<br>Abstracts can be submitted by following this link:<br>&lt;http://eaaglasgow2015.com/call-for-papers/&gt;<br>http://eaaglasgow2015.com/call-for-papers/ [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-09T10:28:44+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Cynthianne Debono Spiteri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;764bc876.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;bdcd1ef0.1501">   <title>Read the first article published in new open access journal STAR: Science and Technology of Archaeological Research </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;bdcd1ef0.1501</link>   <description> The first article has been published in our new open access journal STAR.<br><br>Read the article here: http://www.maneyonline.com/doi/abs/10.1179/2054892314Y.0000000002<br><br>Title: Complications in the study of ancient tuberculosis: non-specificity of IS6110 PCRs<br><br>Authors: Professor Terry Brown, and Romy Muller, University of Manchester, UK<br>Professor Charlotte Roberts, Durham University, UK<br><br>The insertion sequence IS6110 is frequently used as a marker for the presence of ancient DNA from bacteria of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex in human archaeological remains. The specificity of polymerase chain reactions directed at IS6110 has, however, been questioned, because identical or similar elements have been identified in 'mycobacteria other than tuberculosis'. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T14:21:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Amy Ellison</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;bdcd1ef0.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;664ce734.1412">   <title>Life of the Past Series - Indiana University Press - Combined Academic Publishers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;664ce734.1412</link>   <description> Dear ANCIENT-DNA subscribers,<br><br>We hope that these titles are of interest.<br><br>To view the entire \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdLife of the Past\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd series click here&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/life-of-the-past&gt;<br><br>[9780253013859 cl Hadrosaurs]Hadrosaurs<br><br>David A. Eberth<br><br>Edited by David C. Evans<br><br>&quot;Hadrosaurs have not had the wide publicity of their flesh-eating cousins, the theropods, but this remarkable dinosaur group offers unique opportunities to explore aspects of palaeobiology such as growth and sexual dimorphism. In a comprehensive collection of papers, all the hadrosaur experts of the world present their latest work, exploring topics as diverse as taxonomy and stratigraphy, locomotion and skin colour.&quot; \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMichael Benton, University of Bristol<br>Hadrosaurs [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-15T12:22:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Woodhead</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;664ce734.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;3f65d945.1412">   <title>Re: Human Genetics at LJMU </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;3f65d945.1412</link>   <description> Interested in moving to Liverpool? We can watch football all the time! :D<br><br>On 08-12-2014, at 8:01 AM, Eveline Altena wrote:<br><br>&gt; -----Original Message-----<br>&gt; From: BABAO E-mail discussion list [mailto:BABAO-L@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Laura Bishop<br>&gt; Sent: maandag 8 december 2014 14:37<br>&gt; To: BABAO-L@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>&gt; Subject: [BABAO-L] Human Genetics at LJMU<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Dear All,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I wanted to make you aware of the following opportunity. This is an anthropological genetics post, and we are particularly seeking researchers working at the interface of anthropological genetics and bioarchaeology or forensic anthropology.<br>&gt;<br>> Please see the LJMU website [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-09T23:01:28-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Christina Cheung</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;3f65d945.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;9b21e58c.1412">   <title>Human Genetics at LJMU </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;9b21e58c.1412</link>   <description> -----Original Message-----<br>From: BABAO E-mail discussion list [mailto:BABAO-L@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Laura Bishop<br>Sent: maandag 8 december 2014 14:37<br>To: BABAO-L@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: [BABAO-L] Human Genetics at LJMU<br><br>Dear All,<br><br>I wanted to make you aware of the following opportunity. This is an anthropological genetics post, and we are particularly seeking researchers working at the interface of anthropological genetics and bioarchaeology or forensic anthropology. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-08T16:01:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Eveline Altena</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;9b21e58c.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;55159d76.1411">   <title>UK Archaeological Sciences Conference, 8-11th April 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;55159d76.1411</link>   <description> (Apologies for cross-posting)<br><br>Call for Papers<br><br>We would like to invite you to submit abstracts to the forthcoming UK Archaeological Sciences conference which will be held at Durham University 8-11th April 2015. The conference organisers are keen to encourage novel and exciting papers and posters from colleagues working in all areas of archaeological science from fundamental method development to case studies investigating humans, animals, plants, artefacts, sites and landscapes, materials analysis to aDNA, archaeobotany to proteomics, conservation to dating, imaging to isotopes, landscapes to archaeozoology. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;4ffe831a.1411</link>   <description> Preview the first issue of PaleoAmerica: A Journal of Early Human Migration and Dispersal<br><br>Sign up to be alerted when the first issue is available online: http://www.maneyonline.com/loi/pal<br><br>The first issue will be available online from January 2015 - you can view the complete ToC below:<br><br>PERSPECTIVES<br>Introducing PaleoAmerica<br>Ted Goebel<br><br>Kennewick Man Two Decades Later<br>Karl L Hutterer [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-12T09:15:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jennifer Collinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;4ffe831a.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;96d94ca2.1411">   <title>50% discount on submitting to STAR </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;96d94ca2.1411</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;96d94ca2.1411">50% discount on submitting to STAR </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-11-11T11:44:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jennifer Collinson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ANCIENT-DNA;96d94ca2.1411</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
